critique: This executive order establishes a working group to improve chemical facility safety and security. It aims to enhance coordination between federal, state, local, and tribal partners, improve information sharing, and modernize policies and regulations. There is a moderate increase in federal oversight and regulation, but it doesn't drastically shift power. The order seems to be a balanced approach to improving safety and security without significantly infringing on civil liberties or promoting a specific ideological agenda. It does not touch on immigration. It also doesn't seem to strongly promote or restrict diversity/inclusion. It seems to be a fairly centrist approach to chemical safety and security.
